title: Day 4 - Jazz in the Park
summary: This is my blog post for 28 June 2024.
cover: The billboard I saw on the way to Babeș-Bolyai University.
sections: ubb
Babeș-Bolyai University
p
This time, I actually think it would've been impossible to take a selfie with the billboard.
This was on top of a building on the way to UBB, but we all passed it together, so I hope this counts.
This billboard, unlike previous advertisements, doesn't have a list of participants.
However, it is a competition, and entry is free, which probably makes it more appealing than other music events.
Once again, Jazz in the Park has a website.
jazz_park
About Jazz in the Park
p
By this point, I have a standard operating procedure for music events.
The only languages are Romanian (default) and English, but this is much less egregious of an issue since it doesn't literally take place in a Hungarian castle.
This particular festival is a competition, whose top two winners will be invited to perform at the main festival in September.
This competition thus features presumably mostly amateur bands - there are no easily recognisable names as in previous festivals, although I admit that I don't know modern jazz that well.
p
The list of performers is very diverse, and it seems to be all-European.
VeszprémFest suggests that there are a lot of Hungarian jazz bands, but the only one here seems to be from Austria.
I assume Abel Marton Nagy is a Hungarian living in Austria, which would suggest that ethnicity doesn't matter in music.
I can't see an Austrian band performing in Hungarian, while having a Hungarian at the lead of the band is also rather un-Austrian.
Jazz is fundamentally a fusion of cultures, so this particular combination seems rather appropriate here.
